Arg972-IRS-1 carriers had significantly lower serum ACE2 levels and higher MI severity scores compared with wild type-IRS-1 carriers after MI. findings also suggest an important role for insulin/IRS-1 signaling in the increased ACE2 expression after MI. myocardial hypoxia is a major factor in the pathophysiology of MI. overexpression of Arg972 IRS-1 had no significant effect on ACE2 expression in cardiomyocytes in normoxia. a small amount of endogenous wild type IRS-1 in the cells may well suffice for basal level of insulin/IRS-1/PI3K signaling and thereby ACE2 expression. this may explain why only Arg972 IRS-1 carriers with acute MI showed decreased serum ACE2 levels. insulin/IRS-1 signaling exerts cardioprotective effects after acute MI at least partially through increased ACE2 expression.
